dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Mag 7, crypto, Trump coin, AI, Trump, tariffs, Fed, and everything else that will dominate Davos
News Content: This is The Takeaway from today's Morning Brief, which you can sign up to receive in your inbox every morning along with:

The chart of the day What we're watching What we're reading Economic data releases and earnings

Coverage of the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, each year is something I view as a competitive sport.

I actually start training for the intense week over the summer, as my few close friends know (and yes, they all make fun of me). The number of workouts every week in the lead-up rises incrementally so I can easily sprint up and down the two-mile promenade with a backpack to stuff in as many meetings as humanly possible (yes, I do this).

My one cheat meal a week gets replaced by green drinks and extra doses of vitamins to ensure I don't get sick. I meditate twice a day and carefully pick out clothes I know will help me execute at the highest level. Look good, feel good, good things happen.

To me, this one event is the closest I will get to being like Michael Jordan in the playoffs — and I am very lucky to be in attendance.

And this year, the gathering of the elites flying in on private jets to wax poetic on the world's biggest problems will be extra nutty.

Read more: Here are the biggest global risks for 2025

The conference unofficially kicks off on Trump's Inauguration Day. Some CEOs I know who normally would be at Davos all week are dropping in mid-week after working the inauguration party rounds. By Tuesday, the newly minted president may have uncorked a host of executive orders that could impact the businesses of the top CEOs on the ground. And, of course, impact the global markets.

This is why this year's WEF will be more important than the norm for you, the average investor. The headlines will be coming in hot and heavy as CEOs look to challenge Trump or get on his good side. They will also look to talk up their businesses ahead of the start of earnings season, and with markets getting a little rockier of late.

Here's what yours truly and our very own Jennifer Schonberger will be watching while bundled up in five layers all week. Be sure to bookmark the "streaming now" section on Yahoo Finance to catch all our market-moving interviews in real-time. Or tune in where you normally catch us, whether that's on Samsung TV or our nifty app.

Unlike our previous trips to Davos over the past decade, I will be taping several special episodes of the Opening Bid podcast on the ground. I could tell you who those guests will be, but where is the fun in that? Best to be surprised!

Story Continues

Now, on to that guide...

Big bank CEOs: The biggest names in banking, such as JPMorgan (JPM) CEO Jamie Dimon, Bank of America (BAC) CEO Brian Moynihan, Goldman Sachs (GS) CEO David Solomon, Citi (C) CEO Jane Fraser, and Morgan Stanley (MS) CEO Ted Pick will be in attendance. While this group will all get asked about Trump policies, it's going to be their outlook on interest rates that will be most key to market sentiment. Most have not spoken publicly since the Fed signaled a likely halt in rate cuts last month, and they will want to be heard ahead of the Fed's Jan. 28-29 policy meeting.

The tariff CEOs: Retail will have a nice showing at Davos, with the CEOs of Polo Ralph Lauren (RL), Williams Sonoma (WSM), and Gap (GAP) (their CEO's first time at the event) making the rounds. These companies are right in the middle of the tariff debate. I'll be interested in how they are preparing for Trump tariffs from a supply chain perspective. I am also interested in how much they could raise prices post-tariffs — it could offer up valuable insight into the 2025 inflation outlook and Fed policy.

The race to catch Nvidia: It will be another year of AI chatter throughout the halls of Davos. This time, I think the discussions will take two forms. First, unlike last year, where the AI discussions were mostly about potential, investors are going to want to see clear lines to revenue and profits. So I encourage AI CEOs to bring it. And two, we will probably hear more about how Big Tech players in Microsoft (MSFT) and Alphabet (GOOGL) are aiming to develop their own high-powered AI chips to catch Nvidia (NVDA), or at least make good enough chips to diversify. Leaders from OpenAI and Anthropic will also be in attendance, and their thoughts on chips could be key. I'll be watching Nvidia's stock price like a hawk this week, and you should be as well.

Crypto delegation: The crypto industry has had a solid presence at Davos in the past five years. This year the industry is expected to be out in force, headlined by an appearance from Coinbase (COIN) CEO Brian Armstrong. I'll be quite attuned to what the crypto crowd thinks about the latest volatility in bitcoin, MicroStrategy's (MSTR) bitcoin buying binge, what they are hearing from the pro-crypto Trump administration, and early assessments on Paul Atkins as the likely next SEC chairman.

And of course, the new Trump coin that debuted to much fanfare (and market cap) on Friday.

Stocks: Stocks are beginning to look top-heavy (especially the Magnificent 7), as I have reported. I'm eager to hear from market pros such as JPMorgan's Mary Erdoes and economic experts like Nouriel Roubini on if they are seeing red flags on the horizon. Any calls they make at this Davos may hold greater weight given more volatile market conditions and increased Trump policy uncertainty.

The political wild cards: As of this writing, contacts have told me President-elect Donald Trump plans to send delegates to Davos. Who precisely gets the nod is the wild card. (I fancy it will be potential Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick, a Davos party scene regular for many years. Elon has long hated Davos, so hard to see him appearing). Trump himself is slated to give a speech remotely on Thursday, a source told Yahoo Finance.

But who ultimately shows up from Trump's orbit — and what they say once touching down — could set the tone on US international relations right out of the gate. If a delegate arrives at Davos days after Trump takes actions that could weigh on the economic growth of foreign countries and then aims to explain the actions, best believe the inevitable headlines may not be so market-friendly.

—

Brian Sozzi is Yahoo Finance's Executive Editor. Follow Sozzi on X @BrianSozzi, Instagram and on LinkedIn. Tips on stories? Email brian.sozzi@yahoofinance.com. Three times each week, Sozzi fields insight-filled conversations with the biggest names in business and markets on Yahoo Finance's Opening Bid podcast. Find more episodes on our video hub. Watch on your preferred streaming service. Or listen and subscribe on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, or wherever you find your favorite podcasts.

Click here for in-depth analysis of the latest stock market news and events moving stock prices

Read the latest financial and business news from Yahoo Finance

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.75, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.25, Reasoning: The news highlights Apple Inc.'s inclusion in Louis Navellier's top long-term stock picks, which suggests a positive outlook from a respected investor known for identifying high-growth stocks. The company's strong financial performance, including a 6% year-over-year revenue increase and a 15% rise in operating income, further supports a bullish sentiment. Additionally, Apple's advancements in AI and commitment to sustainability may enhance its market position. Given these factors, the probability of the stock price rising is higher than that of falling.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.2, Reasoning: The news headline 'Latest & Upcoming IPOs to Watch in 2025' does not directly relate to Apple Inc. (AAPL). It discusses IPOs, which are initial public offerings of other companies. While Apple's performance might be indirectly affected by the overall market sentiment surrounding IPOs, the connection is weak. Therefore, the news is unlikely to have a significant impact on Apple's stock price in the short term. A slight positive sentiment might arise if the IPO market is expected to be strong, indicating a healthy investment environment, but this is a very indirect and weak signal.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news article focuses on the World Economic Forum in Davos and its potential impact on various sectors, including banking, retail, AI, and crypto.  While Apple (AAPL) isn't directly mentioned, the article highlights several factors that could indirectly influence its stock price.  The "Magnificent 7" (which includes Apple) are described as looking "top-heavy," suggesting a potential for a price correction.  Increased market volatility and uncertainty surrounding Trump's policies are also mentioned, which could negatively affect tech stocks like Apple.  The focus on AI and the potential for competition from other tech giants in developing AI chips could also create some uncertainty for Apple's future growth in this sector.  However, Apple's strong brand and diverse product portfolio offer some resilience against negative market sentiment.  Considering these factors, the probability of a price rise is lower than the probability of a price fall, but neither is overwhelmingly likely given the indirect nature of the news.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.1, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.1, Reasoning: The provided news headline and content are about upcoming IPOs in 2025, which does not directly relate to Apple Inc. (AAPL). Since the news does not contain any information that would impact Apple's stock price, the probabilities of the stock price rising or falling due to this news are minimal. The stock price movement is likely to be influenced by other factors unrelated to this news.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.2, Reasoning: The news article discusses Warren Buffett's investments in six Dow Jones stocks, including Apple Inc. (AAPL). While the article does not provide specific news about Apple's financial performance or future outlook, it mentions that Apple is Berkshire Hathaway's largest holding and that Buffett has praised the company. However, the article focuses more on income investing and recommends Chevron and Coca-Cola for their dividend yields. Apple's dividend yield is described as 'paltry' at under 1%. The neutral to positive tone towards Apple, combined with its significant holding by Berkshire Hathaway, might maintain or slightly boost investor confidence. However, the lack of specific positive news about Apple's financials or future plans could limit significant stock price movement. Given this context, the probability of the stock price rising is moderate, while the probability of it falling is relatively low.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news article discusses the temporary shutdown of TikTok in the US due to a new law banning the app, and the potential for President Trump to issue an executive order to extend the period of time before the law's prohibitions take effect. The article also mentions that Apple and Google have taken steps to comply with the law, but Trump's assurances may not guarantee that his administration won't enforce the law in the future. Given that Apple is one of the companies involved in the compliance, the news may have a neutral to slightly positive impact on Apple's stock price, as the company is taking steps to comply with the law and may benefit from the potential demise of a competitor. However, the overall impact is likely to be small, as the news is more relevant to TikTok and its parent company ByteDance than to Apple.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.1, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.1, Reasoning: The provided news headline 'Latest & Upcoming IPOs to Watch in 2025' does not directly relate to Apple Inc. (AAPL). The news is more focused on upcoming IPOs rather than providing any specific information or impact on Apple. Without direct correlation, it's unlikely that this news would have a significant immediate effect on Apple's stock price.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.8, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.2, Reasoning: The news highlights Apple Inc.'s inclusion in Louis Navellier's top long-term stock picks, which suggests a positive outlook from a respected investor known for identifying high-growth stocks. The company's strong financial performance, including a 6% year-over-year revenue increase and a 15% rise in operating income, further supports a bullish sentiment. Additionally, Apple's advancements in AI and commitment to sustainability may enhance its market position. Given these factors, the probability of the stock price rising is significantly higher than that of falling.

Most models in the previous round correctly identified this lack of direct relevance, resulting in low probabilities for both rise and fall. The initial model's high prediction of a price rise seems to be based on unrelated positive information about Apple, which is not relevant to the provided news. Therefore, I will assign low probabilities to both rise and fall, reflecting the news's negligible impact on Apple's stock price.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The news article focuses on the World Economic Forum in Davos and its potential impact on various sectors. While Apple isn't directly mentioned, several factors could indirectly influence its stock price. The focus on AI and potential competition could create uncertainty for Apple's future growth in this sector. However, Apple's strong brand and diverse product portfolio offer some resilience.  The previous predictions show a range of opinions, with some models leaning towards a price rise due to unrelated positive news about Apple in other sources, while others see a higher probability of a fall due to the general market uncertainty highlighted in this Davos news. Considering the indirect nature of the news and the overall market uncertainty, a neutral stance is most appropriate.  The probability of a price rise is slightly lower than the probability of a price fall, reflecting the potential for a correction in the tech sector and the general uncertainty surrounding Trump's policies.

(AAPL). The content focuses on IPOs of other companies, which has no immediate or direct impact on Apple's stock price. Previous predictions from various models also indicate minimal to no effect, with most models assigning low probabilities to both rising and falling stock prices due to this news. Given the lack of direct relevance and the consensus among previous predictions, the stock price movement is likely to be unaffected by this news.

Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{ 
"reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]", 
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will rise due to this news], 
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
} 
Do not generate output that isn't in properly formatted JSON.

```json
{
  "reasoning": "The provided news article focuses on the World Economic Forum in Davos and its potential impact on various sectors.  While Apple (AAPL) is not directly mentioned, several factors discussed could indirectly influence its stock price. The article highlights concerns about the 'Magnificent 7,' including Apple, appearing 'top-heavy,' suggesting a potential for a price correction. Increased market volatility and uncertainty surrounding Trump's policies are also mentioned, which could negatively affect tech stocks. The focus on AI and the potential for competition from other tech giants in developing AI chips could also create some uncertainty for Apple's future growth in this sector. However, Apple's strong brand and diverse product portfolio offer some resilience against negative market sentiment.  The previous predictions show a wide range of opinions, reflecting the indirect nature of the news and the difficulty in assessing its impact on Apple's stock price.  Considering the potential for a correction in the tech sector, the general uncertainty surrounding Trump's policies, and the lack of direct positive news about Apple, the probability of a price fall is slightly higher than the probability of a price rise.  However, the impact is likely to be relatively small given the indirect nature of the news.  The probabilities are adjusted to reflect the consensus of previous models, which generally show a low probability of significant movement in either direction.",
  "company_name": "Apple Inc.",
  "company_symbol": "AAPL",
  "news_headline": "Mag 7, crypto, Trump coin, AI, Trump, tariffs, Fed, and everything else that will dominate Davos",
  "probability_of_stock_price_rise": 0.4,
  "probability_of_stock_price_fall": 0.5
}
```
